name: places/ChIJ61dEHeNYwokR7ZRDdDhMsys
formattedAddress: 230 E 51st St, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 230 E 51st St, New York, NY 10022, USA

editorialSummary.text: Bright modern hotel offering a rooftop deck with city views, plus a cafe, a bar & free Wi-Fi.

originalText.text: The hotel is very much more of a hostel than a hotel. The rooms were pretty small, but clean, warm, and cozy. No iron, no fridge, and no washcloths (but they did provide towels). Each floor shares the bathrooms and showers. You basically get the bare necessities, and nothing added. Almost like being back in my old college dorm. I'd give a 4 or 3 star instead of 2, but the hotel tags on a lot of extra fees when you're booking that make the price...not really the price. If they're going to sell hostel living, the prices should reflect that. You're basically paying Marriott suite prices to sleep in a bunk bed and share showers with randoms (bring shower flip flops!!!). Great location, close to everything. Staff was nice. Some of the shared bathrooms did not have sinks. That is absolutely disgusting to me. Even if our room had a sink, all the things I had to touch before I could wash my hands make me shudder to think about the germs we exchanged, especially since I came home a bit sick.

originalText.text: It's been a few years since I stayed here in the Full Pod room but I just recommended it to someone and realized I never left a review. We enjoyed a wonderful stay and the walking tour that was included was a nice touch. The room was a bit cramped for two people but we only used it to shower and sleep, which was fine. The amenity areas, especially the gorgeous rooftop with modern furniture and sweeping city views, were where we spent our time at the hotel. It was in a great location and walkable to so much, namely the yummy Ess-a-bagel. I would recommend this as a lodging option whilst in NYC.

originalText.text: Check in was great and the front desk staff very friendly. We were able to check in a few hours early, as our room was already ready. I loved the noon check out! Our room was very clean and comfy. Loved the location. It's close to the subway and there's a bar/game room right next door. The area surrounding it was safe, clean, and quiet. I also enjoyed they could hold on to our luggage before and after our stay, which helped us spend more time around NY!

text.text: Check in was great and the front desk staff very friendly. We were able to check in a few hours early, as our room was already ready. I loved the noon check out! originalText.text:
The late night front desk clerk is incredibly rude and the maintenance person leaves at 10:30 pm. We checked in and were about to head out for the evening when we went by the front desk to let them know that we had no heating in the winter. The told us that we had to be in the room when maintenance came by, did not inform us of when maintenance leaves. So we went out. When we came back the front desk clerk was incredibly rude and unhelpful. I asked to be moved and she lied to my face and said that the hotel was booked for the evening and that she will not move us, in spite of us having absolutely no heat in the middle of winter. They gave us a few blankets. I checked the booking site and there were definitely rooms available.

My boyfriend had to lift the entire grate himself and we found out that the heater was unplugged at some point. Nobody made sure that the room was in working order before renting the space out I guess.

The rooms were clean and space was convenient.

originalText.text:
Cute little hotel. It's in a really great area you can walk anywhere you need to go.

But here's the thing they need to fire their staff and hire new people. Everybody at the front desk acted like you were bothering them. They would just keep on talking while you stood there.

The room was fine for the price. It was small but the drawers underneath the bad help storage.

The hallways are really narrow, so you have to be careful when you're Passing the public bathrooms in the hallways. Because the door swing open and you can get hit in the face like I did.

Would I stay here again I suppose if I couldn't find anything as affordable.
